com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.cache

Interface Cache

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Mutex
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CacheImpl

    public interface Cache
extends Mutex
    The Cache is used to maintain and save instances of Objects.

    This Cache is a low level cache and does not maintain its Object on and of itself. It is meant, to be controlled via the generic CacheObserver.

    If it is not clear, you cannot declare time-periods for objects to maintain those. It keeps all Objects indefinitely!

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • create

        static Cache create()
        Instantiates a new Cache.

        This instance is hidden. Do not cast, nor try to instantiate the implementation by yourself.

        The implementation is an easy target to be object to change.

        Returns:
        a new Cache instance

      • update

        void update(Object object)
        Updates an saved instance within the Cache.

        If the Object-type (Class) of your provided Object is set inside the Cache, this will update the previously saved instance with the new provided one.

        If it is not set, nothing (apart from logging an warning) will happen.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be updated

      • addNew

        void addNew(Object object)
        Sets an new instance into the Cache.

        If the Object-type (Class) of your provided Object is not yet set inside the Cache, this will set the provided instance.

        If it is already set, nothing (apart from logging an warning) will happen.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be updated

      • addAndOverride

        void addAndOverride(Object object)
        Sets an new instance into the Cache, ignoring previously set instances.

        If the Object-type (Class) of your provided Object is not yet set inside the Cache, this will set the provided instance.

        If the Object-type (Class) of your provided Object is set inside the Cache, this will update the previously saved instance with the new provided one.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be updated

      • remove

        void remove(Class clazz)
        Removes whatever instance is associated with the provided Class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the Object you want to remove from this Cache

      • get

        <T> Optional<T> get(Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the internally maintained instance for the provided class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type, defined by the class
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class you want want to get the instance for
        Returns:
        an Optional, empty if nothing is set.

      • isSet

        boolean isSet(Class<?> clazz)
        Returns, whether an instance exists for the provided class or not.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class you want to check for
        Returns:
        true, if the type is set, else false

      • addCacheObserver

        <T> void addCacheObserver(CacheObserver<T> cacheObserver)
        Adds a CacheObserver to this Cache.

        Any set CacheObserver will be notified whenever the call of update(Object), addNew(Object), addAndOverride(Object) or remove(Class) successfully passed for the Object you want to listen to.

        Those callbacks are a great way (and in fact needed for the Registration mechanism) of getting notified.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the Type of that CacheObserver
        Parameters:
        cacheObserver - the CacheObserver, that should listen to this cache

      • removeCacheObserver

        <T> void removeCacheObserver(CacheObserver<T> cacheObserver)
        Removes a CacheObserver from this Cache
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Type of that CacheObserver
        Parameters:
        cacheObserver - the CacheObserver, that should be removed

      • addGeneralObserver

        void addGeneralObserver(GeneralCacheObserver observer)
        Adds an GeneralCacheObserver to this Cache.

        GeneralCacheObserver will be notified whenever any object changes within this Cache.

        It is recommended to use addCacheObserver(CacheObserver), instead of this method.

        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer, that should listen to this Cache

      • removeGeneralObserver

        void removeGeneralObserver(GeneralCacheObserver observer)
        Removes a GeneralCacheObserver from this Cache
        Parameters:
        observer - the Observer, that should be removed

      • clearObservers

        void clearObservers()
        Deletes all Observers.

      • countObservers

        int countObservers()
        Returns the amount of Observers, that are saved within this Cache
        Returns:
        the amount of Observers in this Cache

      • reset

        void reset()
        Clears the internally saved Observers as well as all internally saved Objects.
